events.description:

• Important to know

events.name: Cloud Study Jam Series
events.description:
• What we'll do
Want to work with Google Cloud but do not know where to start? - Join Cloud Study Jam, and get the opportunity to go through an original course from Google (costing more than $ 70) absolutely free!

Together, we will go through three labs in the Google Cloud Platform Essentials, after which you will receive free access to the next quest. You will gain practical experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will give you additional Google badges.

Requirements
Have a laptop with you (with a power supply). The labs will work on all the latest versions of popular browsers. Make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Create a Qwiklabs account at google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up. Make sure you choose an option for promotions! This gives you the right to receive additional free access after the completion of the first series of labs.

Advantages
Upon successful completion of the course, you will receive an official Google badge in your online profile (example) and your potential employers will make sure your knowledge of cloud computing.

Sounds great?
Then sign up

Schedule March 2nd (Friday)
09:30 - 10:00 Registration
10:00 - 10:10 Opening speech of the organizers. Course overview.
10:10 - 11:30 Google Cloud Platform Essentials Labs
11:30 - 11:40 Coffee break / tea
11:40 - 12:40 Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing Lab

Venue: Computer Lab

Participation is free on pre-registration (using RSVP in meetup)

See you!

• What to bring

• Important to know

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit 2018 Extended + Machine Learning Study Jam
events.description:
TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for a full day of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community. We will be doing a recap of what has happened in the summit along with some demos.

The content will be useful to understand latest update and technology advancement about machine learning as well as getting up to date information on TensorFlow.

We will be watching the keynote together and then play with some hands-on demos of machine learning using TensorFlow.

Register @ bit.ly/tensorflowdevadoekiti

events.name: Google I/O 2018 Extended - GCDC Ado Ekiti
events.description: I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

events.name: Next '18 Extended Ado-Ekiti
events.description:
Google Cloud Next 18 Extended

This extended event brings together developer communities in Ado-Ekiti to take part in the Next ‘18 experience, even after the conference.

- Streams of relevant keynotes and sessions
- Demos
- Local speakers
- Hands-on labs (Free Qwiklabs access, a $55+ value)

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
Flutter Study Jam is a community-run study group based on the Flutter Udacity course. Participants learn how to use Flutter to develop high-quality, interactive mobile applications for iOS and Android devices.

Study Jam are a great opportunity to bring members of your community together to learn Flutter in person and support them to complete the course. Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

WHO CAN ATTEND?
Flutter Study Jam is suited best for:
1: Those just getting started with mobile app development
2: Those with programming experience on other mobile app frameworks.

events.name: [Workshop] Build Your First AR App — ARCore - Event-in-a-Box
events.description:
In this workshop we will introduce ARCore to Android developers. There will be food and drinks and we will have an instructor led presentation, followed by a hands on session on how to write your own first ARCore Android app.

The instructor will be there to answer all the questions you might have.

Please be prepared:
• Bring your laptop and install the latest Android Studio on it in advance.
• Please bring an ARCore compatible phone with you: https://developers.google.com/ar/discover/supported-devices

events.name: Flutter Study Jam [Flutter Hackathon]
events.description: This Hackathon is for organized for attendees of the Flutter Study Jam event itself.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam 2019 Facilitator Training (invite-only)
events.description: Cloud Study Jam pre-meetup (for facilitators)

events.name: [Special Event] 2019 TensorFlow Dev Summit Viewing Party!
events.description:
Yaay!

Come March 22nd, we'll be having a (viewing) party for the official #TFDevSummit happening on March 6-7, 2019 at the Google Event Center
Sunnyvale, California USA. https://www.tensorflow.org/dev-summit/

RSVP now to attend to hear the latest exciting news and updates about TensorFlow and watch the livestream with peer TensorFlow enthusiasts in Ado-Ekiti!

Agenda:
=========
12:00 pm: Doors Open
12:20 pm: TensorFlow Dev Summit Keynote
01:00 pm: What can you build with TensorFlow?
01:30 pm: TBA :D
03:00 pm: Doors Close

Don't miss it. RSVPs will close soon. Space is LIMITED! RSVP now.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam 2019 - Baseline: Data, ML, AI
events.description:
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam where you will:

-Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
-Learn how Machine Learning and AI work on Google Cloud
-Get access to Qwiklabs.com, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
-Get Google-hosted badges for your online profiles, to show potential employers what they know about Cloud computing.

Requirements: Come with your laptops as sessions will be very hands-on.

events.name: Women Techmakers [IWD] Ado-Ekiti 2019
events.description:
Speakers will be announced soon!!

International Women's Day (IWD) is marked on March 8th every year. In different regions, the focus of celebrations ranges from general respect and appreciation for women to a celebration of women's economic, political, and social achievements.

Is it only for women?!
We strive to have a broad representation of attendees in tech including developers, designers, technology entrepreneurs, and many others across all phases of their careers, backgrounds, genders, and walks of life. We welcome all to apply!

events.name: I/O Extended 2019 Ado-Ekiti
events.description:
Google I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

I/O Extended events are held around the world for developers to take part in the I/O experience.

GCDC Ado-Ekiti will host a Google I/O Extended where you can join us comfortably to watch the Google I/O 2019 keynote. After that, we will have a moment to discuss all the news and announcements made by Google.

events.name: Infinity With Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
Infinity With GCP Series is where we will go through how to power your apps (mobile/web) with Google Cloud Platform.

By joining this series you will learn to build solutions that authenticate utilising Google Sign-in, make use of Apache Engine for hosting your web apps on GCP, and empower your mobile apps with Google Cloud APIs .

You are expected to:
- Come with a laptop,
- Must have enabled billing in your Google Cloud account, and
- Provide necessary details as required in the form below.

Note that there are prizes to be won

Date: 27th May, 2019 till Friday, 31st May, 2019.
Venue: ICT Lab EKSU
Time: 11:00 AM to 02:00 PM daily

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere Ado-Ekiti
events.description:
Want to get started with Kotlin, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Kotlin/Everywhere event.

Together we'll work through several Google Cloud and multi-platform labs. You will get hands-on experience with Kotlin in Google Cloud Platform, multi-platform with Kotlin/Native and Kotlin/JS.

Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook). The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Chrome or Firefox installed. Don’t forget your charger!

events.name: Flutter Study Jam Ado-Ekiti 2019
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine.
Check out : https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

events.name: Cloud Study Jam 2
events.description:
Join us for our upcoming Cloud Study Jam and get hands-on experience with Machine Learning and AI on Google Cloud.

After the Study Jam, you’ll receive 30-days free access to the entire Qwiklabs catalogue, so you can keep developing your skills at home. Complete all of the labs in the session’s quest, and you’ll earn an additional free month of access to Qwiklabs as well as a badge for your online profile.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

events.name: Flutter Interact Viewing Party!
events.description:
Come December 20, we'll be having a (viewing) party for the official #FlutterInteract happening at Brooklyn, New York.

RSVP now to attend to hear the latest exciting news and updates about Flutter and watch the livestream with peer Flutter enthusiasts in Ado-Ekiti!

Don't miss it. RSVPs will close soon. Space is LIMITED! RSVP now.

events.name: CDS '19 Extended Ado-Ekiti
events.description:
Chrome Dev Summit is a two-day summit to learn about the latest techniques for building for the modern Web, get an early insight into the latest updates to the platform and tools to improve developer productivity, happening on November 11-12, 2019 at San Francisco, California.

ComeDecember 21, we'll be having a (viewing) party for the official Chrome Dev Summit.

RSVP now to attend.

events.name: FSI Hackathon #Pay As You Know
events.description:
If you are a developer interested in building innovative FinTech solutions, FSI and GDG came through with a hackathon using the FSI sandbox API (Access free: http://sandbox.fsi.ng)

Top Prizes: 3M, 2M, 1M Naira.
Virtual Prizes: 500k, 100k Naira.
Register your team here: https://fsi.ng/hackathon

The aim of the hackathon is to provide a solution to fintech Challenges that would enhance financial innovation and empower startups. (E.g solution to make payments easy and flexible, it could be a mobile app or web app. But you will have to use the API on their Sandbox. We have (Nigeria Inter-Bank Settlement System)NIBSS API and Sterling API that you can consume.)

To get started,

Stage 00 - find teammates. Everyone has a great idea.

Stage 01 - register as a member here https://fsi.ng/membership

Stage 02 - the team lead will register the team here after all the team member has completed stage 01. https://fsi.ng/hackathon/register

Stage 03 - Complete the Test given to your team on HackerRank after team registration. (HackerRank is used for assessing developer skills ). The test will be sent to you individually.

The registration will be closing on the 24th of February.

events.name: Firebase Study Jam Ado-Ekiti
events.description:
Join a community of like-minded developers and explore the latest Firebase for Web technologies as a team.

Want to get started building web apps? Learn how to do that with Firebase!

Join us for our Firebase Study Jam! Together we'll work through Firebase for web codelabs prepared by Google instructors.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of popular browsers.

Space is limited, RSVP soon if you want to attend!
